abstract.p: Christina Aguilera will perform at PNC Bank Arts Center in Holmdel, NJ, and Blockbuser Sony Entertainment Center in Camden; photo (S)

block.p: Christina Aguilera is a teenage sensation who might be precocious and pretentious, but at least she can sing. Unlike some of her more famous peers, the 19-year-old Ms. Aguilera can hold a note and even soar with it. But she tries too hard to imitate Mariah Carey. And some of those mannerisms and vocal tics don't even work for Ms. Carey.

Christina Aguilera is a teenage sensation who might be precocious and pretentious, but at least she can sing. Unlike some of her more famous peers, the 19-year-old Ms. Aguilera can hold a note and even soar with it. But she tries too hard to imitate Mariah Carey. And some of those mannerisms and vocal tics don't even work for Ms. Carey.

Ms. Aguilera's hit records (''Genie in a Bottle,'' ''I Turn to You'' and ''Come on Over Baby'') might not be as bubble-gum-catchy, or sleazy-sexy as Britney Spears, but you know that each note, in that impressively wide range, is right on key. Ms. Aguilera performs in New Jersey twice this month: on Wednesday at the PNC Bank Arts Center in Holmdel and on Sept. 15 at the Blockbuster Sony Entertainment Center in Camden.
